questiontext.text:
Categorise the following partial differential equations:

The Duhamel method can provide the solution to any inhomogeneous linear PDE, provided that we already know the solution to the corresponding homogenous equation.
{1:MCV:~=true#Correct~false#Incorrect}

The convolution theorem for Fourier or Laplace transforms allows us to solve nonlinear PDEs analytically.
{1:MCV:~false#Incorrect~=true#Correct}

The separation-of-variables method can only be used for PDEs defined on finite spatial domains.
{1:MCV:~=true#Correct~false#Incorrect}

The separation-of-variables method can only be used for homogeneous PDEs.
{1:MCV:~=true#Correct~false#Incorrect}

The separation-of-variables method can only be used for homogeneous BCs.
{1:MCV:~false#Incorrect~=true#Correct}
